title: >>> Season of REVIVAL ... Season of SURVIVAL
body_text:
It's more than just the start of another season. It's the end of the beginning: the beginning of a new frontier.
Welcome Aboard
It was about this time last year that dodgeball was picking up steam more than ever. Immediately following DODGEBALL X, a mass of unknowns wanted to see what all the commotion was about. It was them that ushered in the first peak in dodgeball.
The next five events were nothing short of spectacular with attendances above 30, new-comers setting new standards, and the action at its true finest. Even now, many of these players from the so-called
New Generation Era
still carry the same drive and passion they felt in 2005; Lenny Herrera, Sara DeCuir, Kevin Fitzpatrick just to name a few.
... But that was then, this is now ...
Times have changed, without question. The framers if you will are rarely to be found. Semi-regulars are almost null and void. What in the hell has happened? It's called Evolution.
Has dodgeball served its purpose? Has it run its course?
Only to the people that don't play anymore. And with the absence of the past masters, it is time to revive the sport. It is time to revive the competition that many still yearn. It is time for the second coming, the second colossal wave of unknowns, the second
New Generation
.
It is time for the
Revival Tour
.
An easy task?
Hell no.
Worth the gamble? Worth the effort?
Absolutely.
The famed documentary suggests that this is "Not JUST a Game" and to some it isn't, nor was it ever. Few will forget the hits they've received, the bursts of laughter, or the friendships they've formed.
If dodgeball does indeed die completely, then it was one hell of ride, perhaps never to be dublicated. Although some believe it to be alive in the grave, the fact remains it's still breathing. If you're up for the challenge, you'll be there.
DODGEBALL LXI kicks off the Revival [Survival] Tour this Saturday night.
body_html:
It's more than just the start of another season. It's the end of the beginning: the beginning of a new frontier.

Welcome Aboard
It was about this time last year that dodgeball was picking up steam more than ever. Immediately following DODGEBALL X, a mass of unknowns wanted to see what all the commotion was about. It was them that ushered in the first peak in dodgeball.

The next five events were nothing short of spectacular with attendances above 30, new-comers setting new standards, and the action at its true finest. Even now, many of these players from the so-called New Generation Era still carry the same drive and passion they felt in 2005; Lenny Herrera, Sara DeCuir, Kevin Fitzpatrick just to name a few.

... But that was then, this is now ...

Times have changed, without question. The framers if you will are rarely to be found. Semi-regulars are almost null and void. What in the hell has happened? It's called Evolution.

Has dodgeball served its purpose? Has it run its course? Only to the people that don't play anymore. And with the absence of the past masters, it is time to revive the sport. It is time to revive the competition that many still yearn. It is time for the second coming, the second colossal wave of unknowns, the second New Generation.

It is time for the Revival Tour.

An easy task? Hell no. Worth the gamble? Worth the effort? Absolutely.

The famed documentary suggests that this is "Not JUST a Game" and to some it isn't, nor was it ever. Few will forget the hits they've received, the bursts of laughter, or the friendships they've formed.

If dodgeball does indeed die completely, then it was one hell of ride, perhaps never to be dublicated. Although some believe it to be alive in the grave, the fact remains it's still breathing. If you're up for the challenge, you'll be there.

DODGEBALL LXI kicks off the Revival [Survival] Tour this Saturday night.
